Sentence 5: In the end the people saw A as the real threat and voted for B.

Sentence3: There were a good many stories to tell, and he told many of them. Sentence 4: Some were easier to make simple than others, it was like a game. Sentence 5: He reflected on how meta it was to write about writing.

Sentence 1: Terry took a creative class. Sentence 2: She really enjoyed the class. Sentence3: A test came up. Sentence 4: She did the assignments to prepare. Sentence 5: Terry passed the test well.

Sentence 1: We all were on a golf trip. Sentence 2: When we arrived we saw all these cops. Sentence3: So when we got to the purse nearby we asked why. Sentence 4: Someone just had robbed a bank and there is a man hunt. Sentence 5: So during our round we would be careful in the woods.

Sentence 5: Darrel waited patiently for his phone to be repaired.

Sentence 1: Mike just finished washing his car. Sentence 2: And he was happy about how cleaned it looked. Sentence3: He decided to drive it around town. Sentence 4: And people stared at his great looking ride. Sentence 5: Mike felt a great sense of pride.

Sentence 1: Tom had new neighbors move in. Sentence 2: They had a couple of cats. Sentence3: They would let them out all day. Sentence 4: Tom often saw them digging around in his yard. Sentence 5: He didn't really care enough to complain.

Sentence 4: One day, someone figured out her true identity. Sentence 5: They told the forum who she was and she lost all her friends.

Sentence3: She would jump from high trees and roll on the ground when landing. Sentence 4: One day she attempted to jump between two high buildings. Sentence 5: She didn't make it, she fell and broke both legs, never to walk again.

Sentence 4: After graduation she prepared for her move. Sentence 5: Her parents were sad to see her go but we're very proud of her.

Sentence 1: Tom was having Thanksgiving dinner with family. Sentence 2: He made the mistake of bringing up politics. Sentence3: Everyone started talking about who they were voting for. Sentence 4: Tom and several relatives got into a big fight. Sentence 5: The entire dinner was ruined.

Sentence 1: I went to turn on the computer. Sentence 2: When I turned it on, there was a blue screen. Sentence3: I decided to call tech support for help. Sentence 4: When I called, they said to reboot it. Sentence 5: I did and the computer worked like normal.

Sentence 1: Kia was late for work one morning. Sentence 2: She had no time to make breakfast. Sentence3: But she was very hungry! Sentence 4: She stopped to a drive-thru on her way to work. Sentence 5: Then she ate in her car as she drove.

Sentence 1: Peter didn't want to go to his afternoon classes. Sentence 2: He chose to cut his classes instead. Sentence3: The principal saw him leaving. Sentence 4: He ran out after Peter and caught him. Sentence 5: Peter was suspended for three days.

Sentence 1: Sam loved playing chess. Sentence 2: He would go out to the park and play strangers. Sentence3: One day a random hobo asked for a game. Sentence 4: Same happily obliged. Sentence 5: They played and had a surprisingly good match.

Sentence 1: Zoe needed back to school clothes. Sentence 2: She hit the mall and was ready to shop. Sentence3: She found lots of great new outfits. Sentence 4: When school began, she was dressed to the nines. Sentence 5: Zoe felt very confident in her new wardrobe.

Sentence 1: Tina realized she should start learning how to code. Sentence 2: She thought it would help her get a job. Sentence3: So she started taking some courses. Sentence 4: At the end she won a certificate. Sentence 5: Tina was very proud of herself.
